intro: Alsodeia integrifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf alsike, is a flowering plant native to the colder regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and along stream banks. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, hard seeds that are dispersed by wind. Alsodeia integrifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to other parts of the world for horticultural use.
